statement.p: Tracey is conducting market research on the cost of a cruise vacation. Tracey has determined that the average cost of a cruise vacation is 3100, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 362.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends more than 2640 on a cruise vacation.
b. The cost of the middle 60 of cruise vacations falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 6 of cruise vacations cost at least how much? (round to the nearest dollar)
